reviewText: Abandoned.  No support.  Control scheme designed by a simian.  A pathetic example of a developer taking no pride in their work nor caring about their customers and just collecting a paycheck.  Mapping the throttle to the Xbox controller's triggers results in the car driving in reverse.  Issue has been noted since March 2015.

reviewText:
Caught in the catch-22 of needing to upgrade my car to get the needed stars to upgrade my car, I am done with this arcade racer.  Luckily it was a few cents in a bundle and was kind of fun up to this point.

In a bundle, it's a 6.  Was higher until the frustration kicked in.

Full price, no thanks.

recommended:
run as fast as you can.

because someone thought that acceleration should be controlled with the joystick. Pure genius.

Lets just jump into a race and see how it feels.
Its clunky but you can actually drive the car

thats positive. Too bad the enemy AI seems to be so much better at it.

While you fly up into the air on every hill you pass

Handling and Boost. Your top speed will only ever so slightly change when you buy a new car.
Dont worry about the upgrades too much since you'll barely be able to unlock any of them to begin with.

Halfway through the game I just gave up because I'm not nearly as masochistic as you have to be to try and complete this game and thats saying a lot coming from me."

reviewText:
Great game, I recommend it to any racing game fan.

Nice career mode with vehicle upgrades, feels like a mobile game but for the asking price it is a lot of fun.  The gameplay feels like Burnout Takedown with the physics of an early PS1 racing game and the graphics are crisp and simple at max settings.  It's like the perfect mobile port, but could use features like achievements and steam cloud.
voteText: 28 of 44 people (64%) found this review helpful 4 people found this review funny

reviewText:
I recall playing the original, it pushed the computer to it's limits graphically, it looked awaome at the time. As a racer it wasn't great but wow. This game is actually cheaper than the original, but is Crazy Cars only in name.
This takes the original and flips it completely. Plain, at best average graphics but reasonable gameplay. It was a fun little blast around the track.
Career mode and a quick play and the rekindling of fond memories, I will recomend it due to the price point as you will easily get a couple of quids worth of entertainment out of it. (You wouldn't get a decent pint never mind a pie as well for this kind of money).

reviewText: I admit that this game does have it's fair share of problems. Not least of which are the sub-par visuals and crazy physics, but give it a chance and you'll find a great little racer in the style of the early burnout games.\n\nOh, and it's ridiculously cheap too!

reviewText: Crazy Cars is a retro racing game that doesn't really deliver much, even for its low price point.\n\nAt its heart, this is basically something akin to Racing USA where you take a car racing across various courses" which are open roads supposedly modelled after a certain sections of the USA
date: albeit the cars and terrain are 3D now. It looks like it was built in Unity3D. No licensed cars
recommended: merely cars that somewhat resembles real cars. There are cars coming the other way down the highway
hoursPlayed: and if you do something really naughty you may see police roadblocks but you can cut between the cars and go through. There are other cars on your side of the road
voteText:
and some roadside obstructions like logs (!?) and stopped cars.

You do have handbrake (for drifting) and nitro. Nitro requires jumps and drifts and other moves to fill up.

There really isn't much handling. Cars don't feel much different
helpfulPercent: and you are encouraged to buy upgrades from your winnings
votesHelpful: which aren't much. You are also requested to fulfill certain addition conditions for additional 'stars' per stage and some of those can't be done with the starting car
votesTotal:
but only cars with lots of upgrades or better cars.

The only "good" part about this game is you aren't limited to a "circuit" and traffic's a bit random. And it's cheap. But it's just not very good. There are some customization options but those cost $$$ in the game that should have gone to upgrades.

All in all
votesFunny: there are much better good racing games out there

reviewText: Gameplay is ok. But you have to race a lot in order to buy a better car. The upgrades are locked by stars which you have to achieve by getting a certain position or by driving to the finish within a certain time. Since your first car is so crappy you might get stuck with getting one to two stars in the first race, maybe even drive within the time-limit in the first race. 3 stars...but upgrades are unlocked with 4 stars. Thus rather drive the first race over and over again until you can afford a better car. The gameplay itself is ok. They should´ve given a slightly better car from the start.

reviewText:
An interesting game, kind of feels like Asphalt Urban GT for the Original Nintendo DS. I would buy it if you have 3 USD to spare and are looking for something to keep you busy if you like street racing games that aren't a total pain in the ♥♥♥. The cars look like actual liscenced cars but they have wacky names, the courses are pretty sweet for being sraightaways, The graphics can either be set to pretty ♥♥♥♥♥♥ or pretty decent looking.

If you want a good game to just mess around with. This is it.

4.6/5

/Captain B-Money

reviewText:
3.7/10 - Not good for 2012.

There is only 1 thing I liked about this game. Career mode had 7 cups and 12 races per cup. That's a lot of races for $2.99! Unfortunately, that's not nearly enough.

Felt like an old Arcade game we would throw quarters at. Just like then it's more fun to watch or remember than to actually play. Controls are not sensitive, races are frustrating and the maps are graphically sad.

I chose the Beautiful" graphics. <=== Not beautiful.

A bundle bust. Worth $0.11

reviewText:
This is the premium game for all the gamers out there.

The perfection and level of depth that this game has to offer has never been successfully recreated though it has been attempted many times (Spider-Man 2, Call of Duty: World at War, The Legend of Zelda, Bad Ratz: The Ratz' Revenge, Portal 2).

Truly a modern classic and a must buy for anyone who calls themselves a fan of video games.

reviewText:
Warning: Incoherent rambling because angry and bored at the same time.

I have a soft spot for bad racing games. I even liked Chevrolet Camaro Wild Ride 3D and regularly play Cruis'n USA. But Crazy Cars?
It's not even trashy.
More like a trash can without trash inside. Just hollow.
It sure looks slick on the store page, I sort of expected the kind of super clean shininess I associate with Kraftwerk's album Autobahn.

* I should have taken the trailer music as a warning.
Gosh, I hate racing game music. By now, it has become a genre of its own. Take a synth loop, some idiotic beat of someone who still listens to The Prodigy, then cheap guitars. I can't even... Why?

* Gameplay: Each crash triggers a boring cutscene.

* I'd rather drive straight forward for 10 hours in Road Trip Adventure on the PS2.

* Deadly Premonition had better driving physics than this.

Now I want to play Crazy Cars again. I want to see these shiny levels. Maybe I'm missing out on something?

---

Okay, I gave it a third chance and it became even worse.

* Each track seems be made of 50% tunnels, which always look the same, probably to conceal level streaming problems?

* The engine sounds consist of two samples.

* After generic racing game music" (see above) came "racing game country" and then "moronic racing game metal".

I've never played the original game
date: but... this... manages to ♥♥♥♥ on many graves at once.\n\nBoring."

reviewText: Ok i felt compelled to write my first review on this game. Having been of the age that remembers crazy cars from way back i though a bit of nostalgia would put a smile on my face.......it did not at all.... The GFX are poor, poor for a mobile, never mind a PC, the physics are non exsistant, you can literally hold down the drift button and drift left to right for the whole race, only impacting your speed slightly and racking up lots of money.... It does feel like an pre alpha version of burnout for a Megadrive (if there was such a thing) It, bad on so many many levels, if you want to waste £1, £2 what ever it was then great and i thought the same but this really does nothing for me, very poor all round, no playability from my POV, GFX poor, Physics poor, no damage on the car even when you plough into the impossbily hard to see cars that are the same colour as the road. The poor bloke driving must suffer about 500g in any accident... sorry but i bought it for the Crazy Car name and it failed to deliver.
